## About
Hannah Merseal is a first-year graduate student in the [Cognitive Neuroscience of Creativity Lab](https://beatylab.la.psu.edu/) in Penn State University's [Cognitive Psychology Area](https://psych.la.psu.edu/graduate/program-areas/cognitive). She graduated from Wheaton College in Massachusetts in 2019 with a B.A. in Psychology and Music. 

Previously, Hannah has conducted research in the [Cognitive Neuroscience Lab](https://wheatoncollege.edu/academics/departments/psychology/psychology-labs/cognitive-neuroscience-lab/) at Wheaton College (Norton, MA), the [ICoN Lab](https://tuftsiconlab.weebly.com/) at Tufts (Medford, MA), and the [Music Dynamics Lab](https://musicdynamicslab.uconn.edu/) at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT).

Her research interests include the cognitive mechanisms behind the production of musical improvisations, neuroimaging methods in music cognition research, and empirical research informed by musicological perspectives. Currently, she is exploring shared production biases between improvisation and language.
